resources.string: Very pale palms of hands or nail beds?
Skin on palms and soles of feet are blue?
Unable to suck or poor sucking?
Redness and discharge around the cord?

This should be recorded using the key provided i.e. 1 for Household head, 2 for spouse, 3 for Child by Birth, 4 for Child by Registration, 5 for grand child , 6 for brother or sister, and 7 for others

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when household member is an orphan. Record (X) if the household member is not an orphan. An orphan is someone with one or both parents dead, and less than 18 years old. Record N/A if member is over 18 years
Record by marking a tick (✔) when household member has a birth certificate. Record (X) if the household member does not have a birth certificate

Record by marking a tick (✔) when the household member is in school , or (X) when the household member is not going to school. The indicator refers to children of school age (for primary education). This is the age of 6-18 years (Ministry of Education of Kenya). Record N/A if member is below 6 years or over 18 years of age

Record by Indicating with a tick (✔) whether a household female member is pregnant or (X) if the household female member is not pregnant. The CHV should observe or ask the woman in the household. Record N/A if member is male

Record by marking with a tick (✔) if a household member who is a mother of a child of 0-11 months completed at least 4 Ante Natal Clinic (ANC) visits during the pregnancy period or mark with a (X) if a household member who is a mother of a child of 0-11 months did not complete at least 4 Ante Natal Clinic (ANC) visits during the pregnancy period. Record N/A if member is not a mother of a child of 0-11 months

Record with a tick (✔) if the household member has been issued with a mother and Child Health booklet. Record (X) if the household member has not been issued. Record N/A if member is not a pregnant mother or child of 0-59 months

Record by marking with a tick (✔ ) if delivery within the past 6 months was through a Skilled Birth Attendant or (X) if delivery within the past 6 months was not through a Skilled Birth Attendant.Note that traditional birth attendants (TBA) are not considered Skilled Birth Attendants. Record N/A if a female member did not give birth over the past 6 months or the member is a male or a child

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the child in the household is less than 6 months and is exclusively breastfed, or (X) when the child who is less than 6 months in the household is not exclusively breastfed. Record N/A if member is not a child of 0-6 months

Record one of the provided numbers i.e. 1 for Modern, 2 for Traditional/ Natural, 3 for None to indicate the family planning method used. This applies to women of reproductive age (15-49 years). Record 4 for N/A if member is not a woman of reproductive age

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when a child aged 6 weeks -11 months in the household was given Penta1 or (X) if the child was not given Penta1. Record N/A if member is not a child aged 6 weeks -11 months

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when a child aged 14 weeks-11 months in the household was given Penta 3 or (X) if the child was not given Penta 3. Record N/A if member is not a child aged 14 weeks -11 months

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when a child of 9-18 months age in the household was given Measles vaccination or (X) if the child was not given Measles vaccination. Record N/A if the member is not a child aged 9 -18 months

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when a child of 9-11 months of age in the household was given ALL vaccinations required or (X) if the child was not given ALL vaccinations required. Record N/A if member is not a child aged 9 -11 months

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the child 6-59 months in the household was given Vitamin A in the last 6 months or (X) if the child was not given Vitamin A in the last 6 months. Record N/A if member is not a child aged 6-59 months

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the child in the household aged 6-23 months receives 3 or more food groups per day or (X) if the child does not receive 3 or more food groups per day. Ask what food the child was given over the past 24 hours and determine the food groups in the food provided. Ask question where there are children of less than 24 months of age. Record N/A if member is not a child aged 6-23 months

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the household child\'s (6-59 months age) mid upper circumference (MUAC) is red or (X) when the child has MUAC that is not red. Record N/A if member is not a child aged 6-59 months

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the household child\'s (6-59 months age) mid upper circumference (MUAC) is yellow or (X) when the child has MUAC that is not yellow. Record N/A if member is not a child aged 6-59 months

Record by marking with tick (✔ ) whether the household member slept under a Long Lasting Insecticide Net (LLIN) the night before or (X) when the household member did not sleep under LLIN the night before.

Record one or more of the numbered illnesses for any known chronic illness observed: 0-None, 1=Diabetes, 2=Cancer, 3=Mental Illness, 4=Hypertension, 5=Chronic Respiratory Diseases, 6=Other. It is a chronic illness if someone has had a diagnosed illness for 1 year or more without healing
Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the household member has had cough for 2 weeks or longer or (X) when the household member has not had a cough or has had it for less than 2 weeks

Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the household member knows his/her HIV status (checked during the past 6 months), or (X ) when the household member does not know his/her HIV status. Record N/A for a small child

Indicate any identified kind or type of disability for the household member by choosing one or more numbers out of the numbers given i.e. 0=None, 1=Visual, 2=Hearing, 3=Speech, 4=Physical, 5=Mental, 6=Other
Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the household has access to safe water or (X) when the household does not have access to safe water
Use of Treated Water \tRecord by marking a tick (✔ ) when the household always uses water that is treated or (X) when the household does not use treated water.
Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the household has hand washing facilities such as Tippy Tap and leaky tin or hand wash basin or (X) when the household does not have hand washing facilities

Use a tick (✔) if the household uses a functional latrine or (X) if the household does not use a functional latrine. The description of functional latrine will depend on whether it is in an urban area (slum or not) or rural area
Record by marking a tick (✔ ) when the household has a refuse disposal facility or (X) when the household does not have a refuse disposal facility
Palm of the hands and feet lighter than normal
Fast breathing ( 60 breaths or more in 1 minute count )
New born\'s weight at birth in kgs
No. of Other Mothers/Women of reproductive age
Number of all pregnant mothers in the household
Number of all mother who just gave birth in the past 6 weeks
Number of all children in the house aged 29 days to 59 months (a girl or boy who is between 29 days but has not reached 5 years)
Number of all children in the house 0 - 28 days of age

Number of all women not included in the pregnant or the postpartum section (all women of reproductive age from 12 years who 1) have children 2) may not have children and are not pregnant 3) are over 6 weeks postpartum)
Men, boys above 5 years, Elderly (above 60 years) and girls (between 5 + years to 12 years - a girl who has reached 5 years but not reached 12 years)
Please enter the actions taken after receiving instructions from the clinician.
How many months pregnant are you
So far, how many ANC visits have you received for this pregnancy
How long ago did you give birth
How many PNC have you attended since you gave birth (after release from hospital)
How soon after birth did you start breast feeding
What has the child fed on since birth
Yesterday (throughout the day and night) what was the child fed on
How many months pregnant were you when you first attended ANC

string-array.name: fed_birth
string-array.item: Breast milk and water (with salt and sugar/ glucose solution)
Others ( solids food, dairy, other liquids)
